stats

Class HttpRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • stats.HttpRequest

  • public class HttpRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the request to the user's profile URL which returns his or her stats as a JSON block.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpRequest(java.lang.String myProfileId)
      Constructs an HttpRequest object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns the user's stats (JSON block) as a string.

      Getter for the url field.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest(java.lang.String myProfileId)
        Constructs an HttpRequest object. This constructor also builds the URL based on the user's hash and a server (which is arbitrarily set to Radius). #RADIUSMASTERRACE
        Parameters:
        myProfileId - the unique hash of a Tagpro player. This is located at the end of the URL when a user views his or her own profile.
        See Also:
        URL

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the user's stats (JSON block) as a string. The execute() method opens a connection to the URL and requests the stats from the server. In the case that someday the REST endpoint shows prettyPrinted JSON, the while loop keeps the prettyPrint.
        Returns:
        The user's stats as a JSON block.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I got lazy. //write stuff here later
        See Also:
        URL, BufferedReader, StringBuffer

      • getProfileId

        public java.lang.String getProfileId()
        Getter for the profileId field.
        Returns:
        The profileId of this instance.

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl()
        Getter for the url field.
        Returns:
        The fully constructed url of this instance.
